definition: fortune-teller
to regard as/to figure/to calculate/to compute
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The 'Laughing Buddha' as Hotei is also said to be the patron saint of restaurateurs and fortunetellers.
sentences.chinese: 笑佛也被稱爲餐館老闆和算命者的保護神。

sentences.english: The fortuneteller told Jane that there was an adventure for her just around the corner.
sentences.chinese: 算命者告訴簡她的一次歷險就要來臨。

sentences.english: Some fortune-tellers say that they can predict future events.
sentences.chinese: 一些算命者說他們能夠預言將來發生的事情。

sentences.english: On the day of his naming, 800 fortune tellers were invited to the palace.
sentences.chinese: 在他命名的那天，有八百個算命者被邀請到宮中。

definition: fortune-teller
fortune-telling/to tell fortune
fortune telling
to divine using the trigrams/fortune telling
to tell sb's fortune using divinatory trigrams
to have one's fortune read/system of fortune telling based on a person's date and time of birth, according to 干支 (sexagenary cycle)
to tell sb's fortune
one's birth data for astrological purposes, combined from year, month, day, hour, heavenly trunk and earthly branch
fortune-teller who uses the subject's face for his prognostication
fate/portent/luck or disasters as foretold in the stars (astrology)
planchette writing/to do planchette writing
religious ceremony/ritual
sorcerer
fortune telling based on the subject's face
to surpass/to transcend/to perform religious ceremonies to help the soul find peace
acolyte in charge of incense in a temple
